Package utilities

Class TargetingSystem

java.lang.Object
utilities.TargetingSystem
public class TargetingSystem extends Object
A class for creating and tracking a target in 3D space. Also allows for predicting where the target will be in the future.
Author:
Icarus Innovated

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    CartesianVector
    leadPosition
    The position the target is predicted to be in by the time the projectile hits it.

  • Field Details

    • leadPosition

      public CartesianVector leadPosition
      The position the target is predicted to be in by the time the projectile hits it.

  • Constructor Details

    • TargetingSystem

      public TargetingSystem(CartesianVector cameraPosition, double cameraElevationAngle, CartesianVector goalPosition, double velocityThreshold, int refreshThreshold, int maxMemory, int maxAccelerationPrediction)
      Creates a new TargetingSystem object with set parameters
      Parameters:
      cameraPosition - The location of the camera relative to the robot
      cameraElevationAngle - The angle the camera is mounted at, relative to horizontal
      goalPosition - The location of the goal, measured on the physical field
      velocityThreshold - The minimum speed that must be reached for target leading to be computed
      refreshThreshold - The amount of time that must pass without seeing the target for the system to reset collected values.
      maxMemory - The maximum amount of previous values to remember
      maxAccelerationPrediction - The maximum amount of time that acceleration should be used in predictions

      public void updateTarget()
      Updates the target position, and computes the velocity and acceleration of the target.

    • updateTargetLeadPosition

      public void updateTargetLeadPosition(double timeToTarget)

    • getTargetDistance

      public double getTargetDistance(CartesianVector robotLocation)
      Calculates the distance between the input location and the target location.
      Parameters:
      robotLocation - The location of the robot on the field, relative to the target.
      Returns:
      The distance between the robot and the target, in the form of a 3D vector.
